    • Aggregating some observations in a data frame

Aggregating some observations in a data frame

Marc Choisy

2018-09-08

Source: vignettes/aggregating_observations.Rmd
aggregating_observations.Rmd

A common task when working on spatio-temporal data frames is aggregating the observations of some variables, either in space, or in time. This can be done easilty with the aggregate_by function of the dplyrx package. Let’s load it:

library(dplyrx)
#> Le chargement a nécessité le package : dplyr
#> 
#> Attachement du package : 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
#> Le chargement a nécessité le package : magrittr

To understand it better what the function can help do let’s have a look at the following meteorological data from the dplyrx package:

data(meteo)
meteo
#>    year     month station temperature humidity rainfall sunshine
#> 1  2013   January Can Tho   26.145161     26.2     15.1    209.5
#> 2  2013       May Can Tho   28.941935     32.3    169.1    232.3
#> 3  2013 September Can Tho   27.076667     30.5    336.7    155.9
#> 4  2014   January Can Tho   24.738710     23.1      1.4    223.2
#> 5  2014       May Can Tho   29.348387     32.1    197.1    251.0
#> 6  2014 September Can Tho   27.316667     30.2    298.1    199.5
#> 7  2015   January Can Tho   25.200000     24.3      0.0    227.7
#> 8  2015       May Can Tho   29.500000     31.4    168.3    278.5
#> 9  2015 September Can Tho   27.700000     30.9    288.6    207.8
#> 10 2013   January  Da Lat   16.103226     14.6      5.0    224.8
#> 11 2013       May  Da Lat   20.070968     19.9    268.6    194.2
#> 12 2013 September  Da Lat   18.300000     18.8    389.7     83.5
#> 13 2014   January  Da Lat   14.793548     13.0      5.9    237.6
#> 14 2014       May  Da Lat   19.851613     20.0    325.6    185.3
#> 15 2014 September  Da Lat   18.760000     19.6    341.5    127.8
#> 16 2015   January  Da Lat   15.500000     13.9      0.1    260.6
#> 17 2015       May  Da Lat   20.100000     20.1    282.2    174.5
#> 18 2015 September  Da Lat   19.200000     19.4    252.9    119.2
#> 19 2013   January Da Nang   21.922581     21.9     17.8    126.1
#> 20 2013       May Da Nang   29.161290     30.6     43.3    288.3
#> 21 2013 September Da Nang   27.126667     30.2    750.8    145.3
#> 22 2014   January Da Nang   20.300000     19.5     86.6    104.3
#> 23 2014       May Da Nang   29.335484     30.4      5.5    280.2
#> 24 2014 September Da Nang   28.686667     31.0    111.5    225.2
#> 25 2015   January Da Nang   21.200000     20.4     24.2    151.5
#> 26 2015       May Da Nang   29.900000     30.9     34.6    281.7
#> 27 2015 September Da Nang   28.900000     31.3    416.0    240.0
#> 28 2013   January   Sa Pa    7.441935      9.9     44.8     62.1
#> 29 2013       May   Sa Pa   19.377419     18.9    401.1    165.9
#> 30 2013 September   Sa Pa   17.056667     17.7    300.0     95.3
#> 31 2014   January   Sa Pa    7.790323      9.4     11.6    128.0
#> 32 2014       May   Sa Pa   20.151613     18.4    118.3    208.0
#> 33 2014 September   Sa Pa   18.533333     20.1    346.2     99.4
#> 34 2015   January   Sa Pa    9.200000      9.9    112.1    143.0
#> 35 2015       May   Sa Pa   21.300000     18.1    297.6    250.6
#> 36 2015 September   Sa Pa   19.300000     19.8    301.4     72.2

This data set contains the values of temperature (°C), absolute humidity (g / m\(^3\)), rainfall (mm) and hours of sunshine from 3 meteorological stations (Can Tho, Da Lat and Da Nang) for the months of January, May and September in 2013, 2014 and 2015. From here, imagine that you want to aggretate all the observations of the stations Can Tho and Da Lat. An obvious way to do so is probably to take the mean. This can be done so with the aggregate_by function of the dplyrx package:

aggregate_by(meteo, station %in% c("Can Tho", "Da Lat"), month, year, fun = mean)
#>    year     month          station temperature humidity rainfall sunshine
#> 1  2013   January          Da Nang   21.922581    21.90    17.80   126.10
#> 2  2013       May          Da Nang   29.161290    30.60    43.30   288.30
#> 3  2013 September          Da Nang   27.126667    30.20   750.80   145.30
#> 4  2014   January          Da Nang   20.300000    19.50    86.60   104.30
#> 5  2014       May          Da Nang   29.335484    30.40     5.50   280.20
#> 6  2014 September          Da Nang   28.686667    31.00   111.50   225.20
#> 7  2015   January          Da Nang   21.200000    20.40    24.20   151.50
#> 8  2015       May          Da Nang   29.900000    30.90    34.60   281.70
#> 9  2015 September          Da Nang   28.900000    31.30   416.00   240.00
#> 10 2013   January            Sa Pa    7.441935     9.90    44.80    62.10
#> 11 2013       May            Sa Pa   19.377419    18.90   401.10   165.90
#> 12 2013 September            Sa Pa   17.056667    17.70   300.00    95.30
#> 13 2014   January            Sa Pa    7.790323     9.40    11.60   128.00
#> 14 2014       May            Sa Pa   20.151613    18.40   118.30   208.00
#> 15 2014 September            Sa Pa   18.533333    20.10   346.20    99.40
#> 16 2015   January            Sa Pa    9.200000     9.90   112.10   143.00
#> 17 2015       May            Sa Pa   21.300000    18.10   297.60   250.60
#> 18 2015 September            Sa Pa   19.300000    19.80   301.40    72.20
#> 19 2013   January Can Tho & Da Lat   21.124194    20.40    10.05   217.15
#> 20 2014   January Can Tho & Da Lat   19.766129    18.05     3.65   230.40
#> 21 2015   January Can Tho & Da Lat   20.350000    19.10     0.05   244.15
#> 22 2013       May Can Tho & Da Lat   24.506452    26.10   218.85   213.25
#> 23 2014       May Can Tho & Da Lat   24.600000    26.05   261.35   218.15
#> 24 2015       May Can Tho & Da Lat   24.800000    25.75   225.25   226.50
#> 25 2013 September Can Tho & Da Lat   22.688333    24.65   363.20   119.70
#> 26 2014 September Can Tho & Da Lat   23.038333    24.90   319.80   163.65
#> 27 2015 September Can Tho & Da Lat   23.450000    25.15   270.75   163.50

The fact that we want to aggregate the observations of the stations Can Tho and Da Lat is specified by the second argument station %in% c("Can Tho", "Da Lat"). Note that this can be specified in any way that can be recognized by the dplyr::filter function. For example,

aggregate_by(meteo, grepl("Can|Lat", station), month, year, fun = mean)

would have worked just as well. Then, after, the second argument are listed all the variables that should be used to identify unique observations to aggregate in each of the stations Can Tho and Da Lat. Here we want aggregate by space but keep the temporal information contained in the variables month and year. The last argument, fun specifies the function that should be used to perform the aggregation. By default it’s sum but here it makes more sense to do mean. Let’s now talk about the last argument of the function, new_name, that we haven’t used in the previous calls. By default, the new value of the station variable for the aggregated observations is Can Tho & Da Lat, i.e. the names of the 2 aggregated stations separated by &. This default behavior can be overwriten by explicitly specifying the new_name argument, for example:

aggregate_by(meteo, station %in% c("Can Tho", "Da Lat"), month, year, fun = mean, new_name = "mean of CT and DL")
#>    year     month           station temperature humidity rainfall sunshine
#> 1  2013   January           Da Nang   21.922581    21.90    17.80   126.10
#> 2  2013       May           Da Nang   29.161290    30.60    43.30   288.30
#> 3  2013 September           Da Nang   27.126667    30.20   750.80   145.30
#> 4  2014   January           Da Nang   20.300000    19.50    86.60   104.30
#> 5  2014       May           Da Nang   29.335484    30.40     5.50   280.20
#> 6  2014 September           Da Nang   28.686667    31.00   111.50   225.20
#> 7  2015   January           Da Nang   21.200000    20.40    24.20   151.50
#> 8  2015       May           Da Nang   29.900000    30.90    34.60   281.70
#> 9  2015 September           Da Nang   28.900000    31.30   416.00   240.00
#> 10 2013   January             Sa Pa    7.441935     9.90    44.80    62.10
#> 11 2013       May             Sa Pa   19.377419    18.90   401.10   165.90
#> 12 2013 September             Sa Pa   17.056667    17.70   300.00    95.30
#> 13 2014   January             Sa Pa    7.790323     9.40    11.60   128.00
#> 14 2014       May             Sa Pa   20.151613    18.40   118.30   208.00
#> 15 2014 September             Sa Pa   18.533333    20.10   346.20    99.40
#> 16 2015   January             Sa Pa    9.200000     9.90   112.10   143.00
#> 17 2015       May             Sa Pa   21.300000    18.10   297.60   250.60
#> 18 2015 September             Sa Pa   19.300000    19.80   301.40    72.20
#> 19 2013   January mean of CT and DL   21.124194    20.40    10.05   217.15
#> 20 2014   January mean of CT and DL   19.766129    18.05     3.65   230.40
#> 21 2015   January mean of CT and DL   20.350000    19.10     0.05   244.15
#> 22 2013       May mean of CT and DL   24.506452    26.10   218.85   213.25
#> 23 2014       May mean of CT and DL   24.600000    26.05   261.35   218.15
#> 24 2015       May mean of CT and DL   24.800000    25.75   225.25   226.50
#> 25 2013 September mean of CT and DL   22.688333    24.65   363.20   119.70
#> 26 2014 September mean of CT and DL   23.038333    24.90   319.80   163.65
#> 27 2015 September mean of CT and DL   23.450000    25.15   270.75   163.50

We can naturally aggregate the observations of more than 2 provinces. For example, let’s consider temperature and humidity only and average their values of the stations of Can Tho, Da Lat and Da Nang:

meteo %>%
  select(-rainfall, -sunshine) %>% 
  aggregate_by(grepl("Can|Da", station), month, year, fun = mean)
#>    year     month                    station temperature humidity
#> 1  2013   January                      Sa Pa    7.441935  9.90000
#> 2  2013       May                      Sa Pa   19.377419 18.90000
#> 3  2013 September                      Sa Pa   17.056667 17.70000
#> 4  2014   January                      Sa Pa    7.790323  9.40000
#> 5  2014       May                      Sa Pa   20.151613 18.40000
#> 6  2014 September                      Sa Pa   18.533333 20.10000
#> 7  2015   January                      Sa Pa    9.200000  9.90000
#> 8  2015       May                      Sa Pa   21.300000 18.10000
#> 9  2015 September                      Sa Pa   19.300000 19.80000
#> 10 2013   January Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   21.390323 20.90000
#> 11 2014   January Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   19.944086 18.53333
#> 12 2015   January Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   20.633333 19.53333
#> 13 2013       May Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   26.058065 27.60000
#> 14 2014       May Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   26.178495 27.50000
#> 15 2015       May Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   26.500000 27.46667
#> 16 2013 September Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   24.167778 26.50000
#> 17 2014 September Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   24.921111 26.93333
#> 18 2015 September Can Tho & Da Lat & Da Nang   25.266667 27.20000
